com.facebook.accountkit.ui

Interface AdvancedUIManager

  • Deprecated. 
    use UIManager instead.

    public interface AdvancedUIManager
    Manager for custom UI fragments.

    • Method Detail

      • getActionBarFragment

        @Nullable
android.app.Fragment getActionBarFragment(LoginFlowState state)
        Deprecated. this method is no longer used and will be removed in a later release
        Returns a custom fragment for the action bar above the scrollable content. This method will be called when the UI state is updating, after `stateDidUpdate`.
        Parameters:
        state - the current state of the login flow
        Returns:
        a Fragment or null for the default fragment

      • setAdvancedUIManagerListener

        void setAdvancedUIManagerListener(AdvancedUIManager.AdvancedUIManagerListener listener)
        Deprecated. use UIManager.setUIManagerListener(UIManager.UIManagerListener) instead
        Sets the listener supplied by Account Kit, which can be used to send messages back to the current state.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener object

      • getBodyFragment

        @Nullable
android.app.Fragment getBodyFragment(LoginFlowState state)
        Returns a custom fragment for the body in the middle of the scrollable container. This method will be called when the UI state is updating, after `stateDidUpdate`.
        Parameters:
        state - the current state of the login flow
        Returns:
        a Fragment or null for the default fragment

      • getButtonType

        @Nullable
ButtonType getButtonType(LoginFlowState state)
        Returns the button type for the given login state. This method is only called for PhoneLogin, EmailLogin, and ConfirmationCode fragments.
        Parameters:
        state - the current state of the login flow
        Returns:
        a ButtonType or null for the default button for that flow

      • getFooterFragment

        @Nullable
android.app.Fragment getFooterFragment(LoginFlowState state)
        Returns a custom fragment for the bottom of the content in the scrollable container. This method will be called when the UI state is updating, after `stateDidUpdate`.
        Parameters:
        state - the current state of the login flow
        Returns:
        a Fragment or null for the default fragment

      • getHeaderFragment

        @Nullable
android.app.Fragment getHeaderFragment(LoginFlowState state)
        Returns a custom fragment for the top of the content in the scrollable container. This method will be called when the UI state is updating, after `stateDidUpdate`.
        Parameters:
        state - the current state of the login flow
        Returns:
        a Fragment or null for the default fragment

      • getTextPosition

        @Nullable
TextPosition getTextPosition(LoginFlowState state)
        Returns the position of the text relative to the content body fragment. This method will be called when the UI state is updating, after `stateDidUpdate`.
        Parameters:
        state - the current state of the login flow
        Returns:
        a TextPosition or null for the default position

      • onError

        void onError(AccountKitError error)
        Called when an error is encountered and should be displayed in the UI. This method will be called before the fragments are retrieved.
        Parameters:
        error - the error
